title: Part 3
content:
Part 3

THE FIRST THING rich people did was dress up in expensive clothes and compete superficially.

Next, they'd move on to battles over houses, cars, and companies.

However, what came next would often turn out to be something unexpected and unforeseen.

Usually, only adults attended these kinds of parties, and children were rarely seen.

However, among the top class of the financial world, it was the opposite; the number of children seen suddenly increased.

That was because it was predetermined that the children would meet each other in the future.

Whether in partner or rival companies, it wasn't entirely bad to have their successors meet face-to-face.

Parents who thought highly of their children were the most likely to bring them along.

They competed with their unique cards as if showing off their prized toys.

You could say that this was why the White Room was accepted in the financial world.

"Ha…"

It was ironic. Those qualities—the ability to choose wisely and the sense of values—were things I learned from Naoe.

Although he now became a detestable enemy, he had undeniably top-notch abilities.

The party had just begun. First, I made my rounds across the room, greeting everyone.

"It's been a while, Ayanokouji-sensei."

Among various greetings, a middle-aged man with an unusually flamboyant hair color cheerfully approached me.

He immediately switched to his business demeanor and turned around, extending his right hand.

"It's been a while, Company President Amasawa. It's been two years, right? I sent you an invitation, but I was nervous you might not come."

"Ah, I couldn't make it last year, sorry about that. My girlfriend absolutely wanted to spend her birthday in Hawaii, and I was too busy with work to find the time. I ended up buying a house there and stayed in Hawaii the whole time."

"It's good to hear that both your work and personal life are going well."

He was slightly older than me, but in a negative sense, he didn't let it show.

He dressed in brands the youth favored and wore sandals that didn't fit the occasion.

If nobody had known him, he definitely would've been turned away from his casual attire.

He wasn't normal. It seemed like he was declaring his unique and original character.

I didn't like this man's style or his way of thinking, but he was one of the people who played a significant role in financing the White Room.

Although he hadn't attended the party last year, he had provided funding.

He was a welcomed guest and deserved to be treated with care.

"Sensei, it seems you're no longer a sensei[1], but you don't let it show, huh? You look just like a shady politician."

He patted my shoulder with his palm, laughing merrily.

"And you treat me the same, just like how you did when I was still a politician."

"Of course. Ayanokouji-sensei, I hold you in high regard, you know."

While having this trivial conversation, I reflected on Amasawa's words from the beginning.

This man was married, but it was clear that the girlfriend he spent time with in Hawaii wasn't his spouse.

"May I have a moment?"

Amasawa, still grinning, guided me toward the window.

"I actually have a favor to ask of you, Ayanokouji-sensei."

"A favor from you, President? What is it?"

"Well, that girlfriend in Hawaii is pregnant. And she insists on giving birth in Japan."

"That's wonderful news, but it's a bit of a tricky situation, isn't it?"

"Right? My wife suspects me of cheating, and if she finds out I secretly had a child, it would be a mess."

If he wanted to play around, he shouldn't have married in the first place, but that was another issue.

"She's afraid of losing her connection with me, that's why she's insisting on giving birth in Japan, even though she's a Hawaii enthusiast."

He shrugged his shoulders as if troubled, but he didn't seem very anxious.

"I'm thinking of having the child educated in the White Room… What do you think?"

"Would you be satisfied with that?"

"Absolutely. What she wants is for our child to be born—that's her goal. She has no intention of becoming a mother and raising the child."

For us, an increase in children who posed no danger was welcomed.

However, there were various things I had to confirm.

"We're already taking care of your daughter in the White Room, President Amasawa."

"Would it be a problem if one more joined?"

"Of course, if necessary, I don't mind. Though, are you sure?"

"Why not? She gets to have a child, I can offload an inconvenient child to the White Room, and you get to profit from it. Everyone's happy, right?"

To this man, the White Room was merely a convenient daycare or something.

For us, it was a favorable and welcome arrangement.

"You're aware of this party's details, aren't you?"

"I understand. Of course, I'll provide thorough financing. Isn't that right?"

He raised one finger as he spoke.

"This year, I'll double last year's amount. I'll give one hundred million[2]. If that can buy my safety, it's cheap."

"Thank you very much. Do you know the expected delivery date?"

"Ah, wait a moment. I'm receiving it in text."

He used his phone to ask for the hospital and the expected delivery date and instructed his subordinate to proceed with the arrangements.

"Well then, we'll handle everything smoothly on our end."

"Thanks a lot."

He nodded in satisfaction and received two glasses of champagne from a boy walking nearby.

"To the happiness of my soon-to-be-born child, cheers."

He tilted his glass, made a 'clink' sound, and drank down the champagne in one gulp.

"By the way, President Amasawa, you are aware of the White Room's rules, aren't you? Unless there's a special reason, visits are basically impossible. You can only meet your children regularly after they become adults or leave the White Room."

"Yeah, yeah. I've heard that before."

"Are you really okay with that? This applies even to the mother."

"Of course. Sending her regular photos should satisfy her."

Getting financing was all that mattered, though, there were formalities to maintain.

There was another thing I had to confirm.

"President, it's been quite some time since we took in your first daughter, but you haven't given us a visit to check on her even once. Have you thought about what you'll do in the future?"

It was relatively rare for a parent who had entrusted us with their child to never visit for such purposes.

Most would come to check on the results.

"As for the future, please do as you like, Ayanokouji-sensei. After all, that was a test-tube baby, and I don't really feel like she's my own child."

Amasawa spoke without interest, as if this was just an extension of his pastime.

The White Room was entrusted with various children.

Some, like Amasawa's child, were test-tube babies, and some were children separated from their siblings in order to raise them differently from the others, testing to see how effective the White Room's education really was.

You always had to maintain control of your tone and make sure you didn't offend the other party, understanding their feelings and circumstances.

"Well then, we'll handle everything on our side as we like."

Currently, she's the second most developed among the fifth generation. Her performance makes it seem like there isn't a gender disparity in abilities, and as long as she doesn't drop out, she'll certainly be useful.

"Of course. Do whatever you like with her."

He casually placed his hand on my shoulder again and began humming happily.

Among the billionaires who had built fortunes worth tens and hundreds of billions, there were those who considered their children's lives worthless.

Though few, this Amasawa was one of them.

He didn't see his child as a status symbol; he was all about himself.

There might be opportunities to take more of Amasawa's children in the future.

"Then, I'm going back now. It's been a while, so I want to enjoy Japan."

"I'll see you out."

I left the cheerful Amasawa to my subordinate and saw him off.

I wanted to take a breather, but there was no time to rest.

  1. [1]: "Sensei" is an honorific that is attached to multiple occupations, including those of politicians. He's saying that Atsuomi is no longer a politician.

  2. [2]: In Japanese, to address units within the hundred millions place, a single kanji is used (億). So 1億 is 100,000,000, which is why he raised one finger.
